intro: Echinella pan, commonly known as the pan flower, is a unique plant native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive flower structure. The plant features a central disk surrounded by ray florets, giving it a composite flower appearance. Echinella pan thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
